description:
An intensive introductory laboratory course in organismal biology. 

BIOL 124 is the companion course to BIOL 121 and may be taken before or after BIOL 121. Students may not take both BIOL 102 and 124 for credit. 

Lab fee $150.
name: INTRO ORGANISM BIOL. LAB

values.comments:
An intensive introductory laboratory course in organismal biology. BIOL 124 is the companion course to BIOL 121 and may be taken before or after BIOL 121. Students may not take both BIOL 102 and 124 for credit.  Lab fee $150.

	Students generally liked this course, with many repeatedly praising the “hands-on nature” of the course. The course was regarded as challenging. Several students described the course as “interesting,” “fantastic,” and “dynamic,” with one student calling the course “so much fun.” Many found the supplementary lectures to be largely extraneous. 

	Professor Robinson was well-regarded by the students. Students said that Professor Robinson was “informative and answered questions,” and she was “a very clear and effective lecturer.” Another student noted that Professor Robinson “is really good at what she does,” though some found her lectures to be boring and useless.

	This course was worth half a credit, but several students remarked that it was a lot of work for a half-credit course. It was generally regarded as fast-paced. Many of the students repeated that the course was very heavy on memorization, which was described as “rough” by a couple students. Many students also remarked of the specificity of the quizzes, which made them “more difficult than expected.”
